content:
At the very least, if you're going to post often, don't put your signature on each post. Reserve your signature for longer posts, which have a bigger impact. (This goes for everyone... we used to have an issue with LL and Unfleexable having 'signature wars' which mucked up the entire community for a while.) (Also, keep in mind, I'm not an admin or moderator or anything--I'm just offering my opinion.)

For example, in this thread, on my screen, each of your posts only takes up a single line, which is about a dozen pixels tall... but then your signature comes right after, and is nearly 180 pixels tall. That's over 10 extra lines worth of text!

Let's say there's a longer discussion thread going on--like the thread LevelLord00 started about Points in the Keen games. If you decide to go in there and write up a longer post about why you think things are the way they are, then sure--tack your signature on at the bottom.

But if your post is only four words and one smile-face long, (like this last one,) you may want to un-check the "Include custom signature." checkbox right above the "Add Reply" button.

Don't worry about it so much--we know you're new here. We're just tryin' to help you settle down a little so that you don't get in trouble. ;-)[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]
